selectedVerses.text: But lately my people have risen up as an enemy; you strip the rich robe from those who pass by trustingly with no thought of war.
Tremble, you women who are at ease, shudder, you complacent ones; strip, and make yourselves bare, and tie sackcloth around your waist.

He rose and struck down the Philistines until his hand was weary, and his hand clung to the sword. And the LORD brought about a great victory that day, and the men returned after him only to strip the slain.
Take the millstones and grind flour, put off your veil, strip off your robe, uncover your legs, pass through the rivers.
The next day, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
